title: Blog website for recruitment startup + AI governance studies

requirements.text: Create a public-facing blog website that presents the userâ€™s recruitment startup work and AI governance research (constraint geometry) with: a homepage, an articles index page, an article detail page, and an about page.

quotes: i need a blog website do publish articles and studies about my own recruitment startup and related to my own work in AI field related to constraint geometry in AI governance

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to the app shows a homepage with clear entry points to Articles and About.
Articles index page lists published posts with title, date, short excerpt, and tags/labels (if present).
Clicking an article from the index opens an article detail page with full content and metadata.
About page exists and contains placeholder sections for the startup and the AI governance/constraint geometry focus.

requirements.text: Implement blog content management with Internet Identity authentication so only the authenticated owner/admin can create, edit, publish/unpublish, and delete articles.

quotes: i need a blog website do publish articles and studies about my own recruitment startup and related to my own work in AI field related to constraint geometry in AI governance

acceptanceCriteria: Unauthenticated users cannot access admin/editor screens or call write endpoints successfully.
Authenticated admin can create a draft article, edit it, publish it, unpublish it, and delete it.
Published articles are visible on public pages; drafts/unpublished articles are not visible publicly.

requirements.text: Add an admin dashboard UI with an article editor that supports writing and previewing article content in Markdown, and editing metadata fields (title, slug, summary/excerpt, tags, publish status, created/updated timestamps).
acceptanceCriteria: Admin dashboard lists all articles with status (draft/published), updated time, and quick actions (edit, publish/unpublish, delete).
Editor supports Markdown input and a preview mode.
Slug is validated for uniqueness and URL-safety before publishing/saving (with a clear error message on conflict).

requirements.text: Persist blog articles in the Motoko backend (single-actor) with stable storage across upgrades, and expose query/update methods needed by the frontend for: listing published articles, fetching by slug/id, searching/filtering by tag, and admin CRUD operations.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend provides query methods for public: list published articles and fetch a published article by slug (or id).
Backend provides admin-only update methods for create/update/delete and publish/unpublish.
Articles persist across canister redeploy/upgrade using stable state patterns; no data loss for saved articles.

requirements.text: Add basic discoverability features on the public articles index: client-side search by title/summary and filter by tag, with pagination or incremental loading if the list is long.
acceptanceCriteria: User can type into a search field and see the list filter by matching title/summary.
User can click a tag filter and see only articles with that tag.
If pagination/incremental loading is used, the UI clearly indicates more results and loads the next set correctly.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent visual theme across the site (typography, spacing, components, and color palette) suited to a research-driven recruitment + AI governance blog; avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.
acceptanceCriteria: All pages share consistent layout primitives (header, content width, headings, article typography).
Primary accents are not blue/purple; the palette is applied consistently to buttons/links/highlights.
Article detail typography is optimized for long-form reading (line length, headings, code/quotes if present).

requirements.text: Generate and include required static brand images, and wire them into the frontend as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve them via the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: All generated images are present in frontend/public/assets/generated with the exact filenames requested.
Header/site chrome uses the generated logo and favicon is set.
Homepage uses the generated hero banner.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Do not edit immutable hook/entry files listed by the platform (compose around them).
Use English for all user-facing UI text.
nonGoals: Multi-author roles/permissions beyond a single admin owner.
Comments, likes, user accounts beyond Internet Identity admin.
External CMS integration (e.g., Ghost, WordPress) or external databases.

required: Minimal geometric logo mark with wordmark, monochrome/earth-tone palette (startup-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide hero banner illustration featuring abstract constraint-geometry motifs (hero-constraint-geometry.dim_1600x600.png)
Simple favicon derived from the logo mark (favicon-constraint.dim_64x64.png)

goalsToAdd: Publish articles and studies about a recruitment startup and AI governance research (constraint geometry).
preferencesToAdd: Prefer a research/editorial visual style; avoid blue/purple as primary colors.
